column1: Quick guide to getting your questions answered on HealthTap
column2: 在HealthTap上解答问题的快速指南

column1: Be Easy to Understand
column2: 容易理解

column1: Questions must be in English, easy to understand, and about health or wellness topics. Common abbreviations are fine to use, but avoid unusual abbreviations.  HealthTap experts are U.S.-licensed doctors and seldom answer questions about uniquely foreign medications, or about hospitals and procedures in other countries.
column2: 问题必须是英文形式、容易理解，并且是关于健康主题的。通用的缩写可以使用，但要避免不常见的缩写。HealthTap的专家是美国授权的医生，很少回答有关独特的外国药物或关于其他国家的医院和程序的问题。

column1: Ask Meaningful Questions
column2: 询问有意义的问题

column1: Questions must include enough detail to be meaningful and answerable.  Vague questions that name a topic (for example, “I have a discharge”) without asking something specific are hard to answer. Try to mention whether the question is about a man or a woman, whether the topic relates to a certain age group, how long ago the symptoms started, and which parts of the body are affected.
column2: 问题必须包含足够的细节才是有意义和可回答的。提出一个主题（例如，“我有一个释放”）但没有询问具体问题的模糊问题很难回答。尝试提及无论问题是关于男人还是女人，无论该主题是否涉及某个年龄组，症状开始多久以及身体的哪些部分受到影响。

column1: Check Spelling of Words and Medicines
column2: 检查单词和药物的拼写

column1: Doctors may not understand a question if it contains many misspelled words. Lab test results should not be just numbers, but should include the units of measurement (such as pounds or mg/24hr).  If you mention a medication not available in the United States, be sure to include the generic name or the American brand name.
column2: 医生可能不能理解如果问题中包含太多的拼写错误。实验测试的结果不能仅仅是数字，而需要包含测量单位（如磅或mg/24hr）。如果您提及在美国不提供的药物，请务必包括通用名称或美国品牌名称。

column1: Stay Private
column2: 保持私人

column1: Do not include your name, names of other people, nor doctors’ names in the question.
column2: 在问题中不要包含您的姓名、其他人的姓名或医生的姓名。
